message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.CC 

This paper deals with information theoretic aspects of coding theory, specifically in the context of the Index Coding problem. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper also involves network coding and communication networks, which suggests the possibility of it being categorized under cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Additionally, the paper uses combinatorial techniques, which could lead to it being categorized under cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) or cs.CC (Computational Complexity). Finally, the paper deals with the concept of side information, which could lead to it being categorized under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
